page.title: 18Angling at Pitsford Water
page.content: In an interview on 1st.July,1985,the warden described how the area has become a{popular location}for trout fishing. The water is{stocked}in November or December with about 5OOO brown trout and 7OOO rainbow trout. Over half of the rainbow trout will not survive a bad winter.The warden was surprised that there are{no pike}in Pitsford. {Trout}may only be caught by fly fishing. Fish under 12" long must be put back.Any person breaking this rule faces an{immediate ban}from the water. There are 12O season tickets available at Â£3O each. Most people buy Â£5 (day) or Â£3.5O (evening) tickets. The{record {catch}stands at 8lb 9oz for a brown trout and 7lb 6oz for a rainbow. The warden commented on how{few {women or girls}seemed to be attracted to the sport of angling.
